name: Hilton Garden Inn Columbus/Grove City

reviews.text: The hotel is near the Interstate and situated among numerous chain stores and mini-malls. Beds were comfortable and bathrooms were up to date. Hilton Honors benefits included an OK full breakfast in the restaurant. There is a small fitness room and pool. A simple request for an extra pillow at checkin produced no results until a second request the following day. The door to our room was almost impossible to close because of a faulty hinge. Attempts by maintenance personnel to make repairs were only partially successful. Otherwise, hotel staff were friendly and helpful, including housekeepers who were responsive to requests for extra towels.
reviews.title: Good accommodations if you're in the area

reviews.text: Hotel in conveniently located near stores and restaurants. Typical HGI property; clean, well appointed rooms and very good breakfast. I especially liked the friendly and helpful front desk staff who were very excellent in providing friendly service.
reviews.title: great front desk staff

reviews.text: Rooms were spacious with good work area provided, office chair was best I have experienced. New laminate floor in the entry and bathroom, however, previous flooring must have had a higher trim, now the flooring trim doesn't reach the wall paper leaving an unsightly gap.
reviews.title: Above average for mid-grade hotel

reviews.text: I could not get the free wifi to connect. When I called the desk I was told "We do not know how to work that either, use the red cable in the desk drawer or call Lodgenet for help".
reviews.title: Hope your toilet and elevator works !

reviews.text: The management of the hotel looked to have their handsfull during the last night of our stay. Several Little League teams checked in for a local tournament and I am CERTAIN that not enough supervision was brought along with these groups. Kids were running up and down the halls until after mid-night. At one point I opened my door and counted 13 kids in the hallway, not an adult to be found anywhere. I know kids will be kids and I also didn't think it was the hotels responisibility to police this but, it was annoying.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay,Woodbridge,Ont,Canada

reviews.text: I was in Grove City for a business meeting and choose the HGI based on location. Checking in was a pleasure, the staff behind the desk went out of their way to show how glad they were for my business. Even though I choose points over the bottle of water, the check in clerk handed me 2 bottles and told me to have a good night.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in the cluster of Jackpot road

reviews.text: The next moring I did breakfast at the hotel - $7.99. I started to get up to serve myself and the super friendly waitstaff said "Oh, you can sit down - tell me what you want and I'll get it. I had fruit, cereal, and an excellent egg white omlette with mushroom and bacon. Sure, some of the hilton chain give a free breakfast (Hampton Inn), but this was the best $7.99 I've spent. It put me in a great mood for the whole day.
reviews.title: Great staff, just remodeled

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed linens are quite comfortable, and the room was spacious. I took advantage of the gym on my trip and was impressed with the facilities.
reviews.title: Great hotel at a good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is where I'll stay on my next trip back!
reviews.title: Worst breakfast ever! Inedible!

reviews.text: I am in Columbus often on business and will always choose this hotel. The staff makes this my go-to place to stay in this area. The front desk staff is always helpful, welcoming and professional. The hotel has just been remodeled and everything is fresh and new (fall of 2011). The restaurant is open for breakfast and dinner and the food is good and not over-priced. Rooms have a coffee maker, microwave and a small fridge. The pool and workout rooms are clean and well-cared for. Housekeeping never misses on restocking coffee, towels or supplies.
reviews.title: Slightly Below Average for a Hilton Garden Inn

reviews.text: We have stopped here twice now - both because it is half way to see our daughter in college. They make you feel so welcome - you never want to get back on the road again!! The staff is out of this world. Enjoyed the custom breakfast immensely. So worth the money on this hotel over others who offer "free breakfast"
reviews.title: Outstanding breakfast and room !

reviews.text: I travel for business and stay at many different hotels. This was one of the best I've stayed in for a while. It's newly renovated with big showcase curtains as you walk through the door. The staff was extremely pleasant. The new beds were great and was the best sleep I've had in months. I didn't want to get up! Breakfast was good as always (used Hampton points instead of paying). I'll definitely be staying here again during my next trip to Columbus.
reviews.title: Beautiful with new comfy beds!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms with a view....meaning more than a tiny prison window for light. Open, airy, and welcoming.
reviews.title: Hilton Garden Is Becoming My Favorite

reviews.text: Kudos to your cleaning staff! We stayed for two nights in a first floor room and it was one of the cleanest hotel rooms we have stayed in! When we returned to our room on the second day...the room looked like we had just checked in! Everything was neatly layed out and crisp and clean looking. Very impressive! Our family joined us for breakfast and they were treated with the same welcoming care that we were. Thank you for the great stay!
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: Recently remodeled, this hotel offers a high quality room featuring adjustable beds, large flat screens and new FFE. They also offer room service for dinner which is something you don't find very often in a limited service brand. The staff is attractive, friendly and professional. If I had to find something to complain about it would be a small complaint that they didn't use concrete floors and you can hear footsteps above you. Booking a room on the top floor solves this problem.
reviews.title: Not Sure How I would improve it
Convenient and recently updated
reviews.text: Stayed for business and personal. Lobby recently updated with Hilton's new Garden Inn concept: hip, open concept (similar to the new Marriott Coutyard's in urban settings). Very friendly staff. Rooms were on par with other Garden Inns I've stayed at. We would stay here again. Gym was small and Jacuzzi cold but other than that we were happy with our choice to stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently visited this property, and below are the pros/cons from our experience:
reviews.title: Very Good for this type of Hotel

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Road Trip Rest Stop

reviews.text: ~Very Clean (no bed bugs)
reviews.title: Dissapointing experience

reviews.text: ~Relatively Quiet
reviews.title: Property renovation just completed! Great property!

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Columbus/Grove City Hotel
description: Welcome to Grove City! The Hilton Garden Inn Columbus/Grove City hotel is only 6 miles south of downtown Columbus off I-71, in the business suburb of Grove City. Conveniently located near numerous office buildings and business parks. Within 10 minutes of the Hollywood Casino and 5 minutes of the Scioto Downs casinos, German Village, Ohio Auto Auction, Beulah Park and Ohio State University. The Hilton Garden Inn Columbus/Grove City, Ohio hotel restaurant, The Garden Grill® serves freshly prepared breakfast and dinner. Come enjoy a taste of Ohio hospitality and exceptional service at the Hilton Garden Inn Columbus/Grove City hotel.
